result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew S Waddell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to Jail (Misdemeanor), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1r)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Submit DNA sample.
Consecutive to: 15CF59.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: JOC returned from 7810 Russet Rd Sun Prairie with forwarding address of 7720 Shady Drive, Sun Prairie. Resent to that address.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Cases called: 15CF59 (probation revocation) & 15CM485 (plea/sentencing), Defendant Matthew S Waddell in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In 15CM485, Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment. In 15CF59, Revocation paperwork received, no corrections. Sentencing arguments heard. Statement of defendant. Sentences: 15CF59:  on ct. 2, 8 months jail. Huber granted under 303.08 for treatment and work. May transfer sentence to Dane Cty. Jail.  Civil judgment for unpaid costs. On ct. 4, 30 days jail, consecutive to ct. 2. Huber granted under 303.08 for treatment and work.  84 days jail credit. 15CM485:  40 days jail, consecutive to 15CF59.  Huber granted under 303.08 for treatment and work. May transfer sentence to Dane Cty. Jail.  $443 costs. Submit DNA sample. Huber granted under 303.08 for treatment and work.  No jail credit.   Cases called 1:40 p.m., adjourned 2:16 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Motion for Preservation of Evidence filed by Attorney Amanda Riek
Filed by DA Office
Filed by District Attorney Jane Kohlwey
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on August 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant, Matthew S Waddell, appeared by jail video with Attorney Alicia Nall, special for the public defenders office. Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Reading waived.  Warrant quashed. Address: 7810 Russet Road, Sun Prairie WI 53950  $2,000 recog. bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 09:50 am.  Return date scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
